events.title: First Transatlantic Telephone Service
events.description: The first transatlantic telephone service was inaugurated, linking New York City and London and marking a major breakthrough in international telecommunications.
events.significance: This event revolutionized global communication, reducing the time for voice communication across the ocean from weeks (via mail) to minutes.

events.title: Ellis Island Closes as Immigration Station
events.description: Ellis Island officially ceased operations as the primary immigration processing center for the United States.
events.significance: This marked the end of an era for one of the busiest immigrant inspection stations, symbolizing changes in U.S. immigration policy and administration.

events.title: NASA's Space Shuttle Columbia Lands After First Mission
events.description: NASA's Space Shuttle Columbia completed the first-ever space shuttle mission and safely returned to Earth, landing at Edwards Air Force Base.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of routine human spaceflight missions with reusable spacecraft, pioneering a new era of space exploration.

events.title: Margaret Thatcher Resigns as UK Prime Minister
events.description: Margaret Thatcher announced her resignation after more than a decade in office, ending the longest continuous tenure of any British prime minister in the 20th century.
events.significance: Her resignation marked a significant political shift in the UK, influencing the Conservative Party and British politics for years to come.
